comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: weird, there was nothing to click on the result to see more info. let's wait for the new CI run.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: After adding the `"debugType": "portable"` setting, did you build powershell and try debugging it with vscode on Linux/OS X? This setting probably won't affect Linux build at all, but I just want to be sure.

comments.author: adamdriscoll
comments.body: I haven't tried on Linux. I'll put together a VM this weekend and test.

comments.author: adamdriscoll
comments.body:
I was able to build and debug on Ubuntu 16.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1256531/17833743/db197e3e-66eb-11e6-8f46-d0801084a844.png)

comments.author: adamdriscoll
comments.body: Hmmm. Do you guys have any idea why this happens? It was lined up fine locally. When I edited in the GitHub UI it was still a space off.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
Probably just tabs vs spaces.

Honestly some JSON files got added with disregard to existing formatting, and so I need to do a clean up anyway. Don't worry about it.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: It seems you missed `powershell-win-core\project.json` and `powershell-unix\project.json`. The `debugType` setting should be put in the `buildOptions` section within `netcoreapp1.0` target framework.
